intro: Anemonastrum narcissiflorum subsp. crinitum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to hot, dry environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
